issue.title: Generalize CutoffSplitter to accept non-integer cutoffs and forecasting horizons

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->

Next step in #1737.

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->

The main change is to allow datetime `cutoffs` and timedelta `fh` in `CutoffSplitter`. No regressions were introduced. More test cases are added in `sktime.forecasting.model_selection.tests.test_split.test_cutoff_window_splitter`.

More detailed description of changes:
- Reused type checking functions from `sktime/utils/validation/__init__.py` in `sktime.forecasting.base._fh._check_values`.
- Added `pd.TimedeltaIndex` to `RELATIVE_TYPES` in `sktime/forecasting/base/_fh.py` to allow timdelta forecasting horizons.
- Added `pd.TimedeltaIndex` to `VALID_INDEX_TYPES` in `sktime/utils/validation/series.py` to allow timdelta forecasting horizons.
- Added `TEST_CUTOFFS` to `sktime/forecasting/tests/_config.py` so that all splitter test configurations are collected in one place.
- Added `TEST_FHS_TIMEDELTA` to `sktime/forecasting/tests/_config.py`. These are timedelta forecasting horizons used in test cases for `CutoffSplitter`.
- Made `sktime.utils.validation.tests.test_forecasting.test_check_fh_empty_input` more precise by adding `match` argument to `raises`.
- Added a few new type checking functions in `sktime/utils/validation/__init__.py` which are used in splitters and corresponding tests.
- Generalized `sktime.utils.validation.forecasting.check_cutoffs` to allow datetime cutoffs.

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?

<!--
If your contribution does add a new hard dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum.
-->
None

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

<!-- This section is particularly useful if you have a pull request that is still in development. You can guide the reviews to focus on the parts that are ready for their comments. We suggest using bullets (indicated by * or -) and filled checkboxes [x] here -->

#### Any other comments?
<!--
Please be aware that we are a loose team of volunteers so patience is necessary; assistance handling other issues is very welcome. We value all user contributions, no matter how minor they are. If we are slow to review, either the pull request needs some benchmarking, tinkering, convincing, etc. or more likely the reviewers are simply busy. In either case, we ask for your understanding during the review process.
-->

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [X] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [X] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

##### For new estimators
- [ ] I've added the estimator to the online documentation.
- [ ] I've updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my estimator works.


<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

issue.title: [MNT] add xfails in `test_plotting` until #2066 is resolved

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This adds `xfail` escapes to the stochastically failing tests on windows CI/CD reported in #2066.

Once the root cause is identified and the bug fixed, these `xfail`s should be removed.

body:
Some thoughts and observations:
* I´ve been also encountering these recently. Could a package update be responsible? `matplotlib` and `tkinter` haven´t been updated since Dec so is probably not the cause.
* The recent test refactor https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2142 is probably also not the cause, since @khrapovs reported this already two weeks ago.

issue.title: [MNT] remove pytest-xdist to diagnose #2066

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
The bug in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2066 may have become more frequent since `pytest-xdist` was added.

This PR checks the hypothesis by removing `pytest-xdist`.

Note to reviewers: `main` currently has #2144 which adds `xfails` to the problematic tests.
This is currently not merged to this PR, and merge will mask overall pass/fails below.

body: addressing this temporarily by https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2146 by `skip`-ping the tests in question
#2145 to diagnose whether occurrence has to do with `pytest-xdist` - one run didn't triger the error (`pytest-xdist` removed)

issue.title: [MNT] add skips in `test_plotting` until #2066 is resolved

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
`xfail` does not resolve the failures in `test_plotting` since the tests are still executed and error out, `pytest` does not catch this.

This PR hence replaces `xfail` by `skip`.

Temporary fix for #2066, follows #2144.

issue.title: [MNT] add skips to entirety of `test_plotting` until #2066 is resolved

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR hence replaces adds `skip` to all tests in `test_plotting` - the #2066 issue seems to stochastically affect all tests in the file.

Temporary fix for #2066, follows #2144 and #2146.
